2.25.23  8:41 am   why is it called a building when it's already built?

2.25.23  8:02 am   So for the middle section on "if the world doesn't end " again, at " when one world ends" I  think its Ebmin7, but for " comes alive " my ear wants to hear an Fmin7 but I'm hearing a C in the bass

      and the second inversion of that Fmin7 doesn't sound quite right there when I play it with the song so I'm not sure.

     But I think for "comes along for the " you switch to an f major

     which in my mind functioned as a 5 to modulate to Bb but then u did an interrupted cadence to gmin7 on "ride" which I loved. Then on "Change you're mind" I'm hearing a Dmaj7/E then an Abmaj7 then it goes back to the sus2sus4 voicing on the E on "stay for a while". Then I'm not too sure but I think I've got the chords for the bit that follows which leads back to the main verse:
Amaj7 Abmaj7 Dmaj7/E

     Ab Db

     I was also wondering why there were so many major 7th chords with their 2nds in the bass in this middle section,

      it's a very specific sound that's amazing to listen to and I don't remember hearing it in many of you're previous songs , correct me if I'm wrong tho.

2.25.23  5:22 am   why does who,what,when,whom,whose,which and where" all start with a w but how starts with an h

do you think that your existence has something to do with this decision?

2.24.23  11:31 pm   Is it possible to write without constantly being trapped in an "editor mindset"?

2.24.23  9:40 pm   Is there a name for when you substitute a min7 chord for a dom7 chord? Like, if you're in C major and you do an D7, E7, or A7 (instead of Dm7, Em7, Am7)?

     It doesn't feel like a "modal interchange" or anything fancy like that because the melody will still feel very much like plain old C major. And sometimes too you'll even have a C7 (particularly before going to the F), but it doesn't feel like you're in C mixolydian or anything like that. <

     I can think of a lot of songs (especially common in old timey songs) that have a chord pattern like:

C C7 F F#dim C A7 D7 G7 C A7 D7 G7 C

But it still feels and sounds like C major even though most of those chords aren't in the key. Would you still consider that to be in C major?

     Maybe the key of a song is totally based on the melody and not the harmony?

2.23.23  5:48 pm   For the middle section of "if the world doesn't end " where ut goes "its good its bad" I understand that it starts on a gmin7 then I think moves to a F#maj7/Ab on "been like that". But on "rearrangement " I can't work out what goes on in that bin but on the "yh" I know it settles on a f#maj7 but I'm wondering how u got there in terms of approaching it harmonically.

     Also for the " it's wrong its right " am I right in saying it goes from Cmin7add9

     to some variation on Bbmin7?

      I can hear a really sick synth slide to a C and F on "slipped into this new rhythm " which makes me think it could be a sus 2 or something on the Bb.

     It's by far my favourite middle section of yours though.
